Abstract: This autobiographical account chronicles the professional journey of a strategic scientist whose career has been intricately woven with the evolution of radio astronomy and astro-geodynamics. The narrative begins with formative years in China, where early exposure to the burgeoning field of Very Long Baseline Interferometry (VLBI) sparked a lifelong passion for deep space exploration. As the story unfolds, it highlights pivotal moments that shaped the author's scientific trajectory, including significant contributions to the development of VLBI techniques and their application in astro-geodynamics. These advancements have not only enhanced our understanding of the universe but also facilitated precise measurements of Earth's movements, contributing to geodetic and navigational accuracy. The narrative further explores the role of international cooperation in advancing scientific frontiers, detailing collaborations with global institutions that have been instrumental in pushing the boundaries of radio astronomy. Through a reflective lens, the author examines the interplay between time and space in both a scientific and personal context, offering insights into the challenges and triumphs encountered along the way. This journey underscores the importance of strategic thinking and collaboration in scientific endeavors, ultimately advocating for a future where international partnerships continue to drive innovation and discovery in the exploration of the cosmos.
